intro: Maytenus salicifolia, commonly known as the willow-leaf mayten, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Peru. The plant is characterized by its slender, willow-like leaves that are opposite and lanceolate in shape. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, fleshy berries. Maytenus salicifolia is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
